data.title: Character Guide/FAQ
data.text: The King Of Fighters Cast FAQ version 3.6 ----------------------------------------- Written by: Psyke E-mail: psyke@singnet.com.sg Maintained by: Orochi K E-mail: kartelkertra <at> caramail <dot> com Date: April 29, 2002 Version History --------------- Version 1.0 - Includes characters for KOF '94 to '98 Version 1.1 - Added characters for KOF '99: Millennium Battle - Changed '95 Iori team to Rival Team - Added in Credits section Version 1.3 - Cleared some stupid mistakes - Changed some names Version 1.4 - Some corrections - Added in strikers in KOF '99 : Evolution for Dreamcast Version 2.0 - Added all characters for KOF 2000 and 2001 - Changed two team's name: Women Fighters Team & Korean Team (they're supposed to be the official names) - Added notes Version 3.0 - Other games added (AoF, Garou, Ikari Warriors, Psycho Soldiers) - Mistake on Goro corrected. Version 3.1 - Added Ling, I completely forgot about him. Version 3.2 - Spellchecked. =I Version 3.3 - Added KOF R1 & R2 and KOF EX. I also changed the format a bit because it was becoming kinda hard to navigate due to the long lists. Version 3.4 - Added note about KOF '99 and Evolution (by request). Also changed the Garou: Mark of the Wolves abbreviation from GA to MOTW. Version 3.5 - Extended list to 3 other titles (thanks to ShadowNash). Version 3.6 - E-mail change! ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1) Introduction <Psyke> Okay, I was bored for the holidays and since it has been quite I while since I've written another faq so I thought I'd just write up a cast faq of all the characters of my fave game series, the King Of Fighters. I wrote one for the SF series quite a while back, and I'm having it updated as well. : ) This faq will aim to clearly state all the characters in the KOF universe, and if requested I might also extend the characters from the KOF universe to the other related characters, such as The Art Of Fighting, Fatal Fury, and Real Bout. But for now, I'll only state the characters who appeared in the KOF series 94 to 99, and the number of their appearances. As a side note, KOF '99 was titled : Episode 5 in the game's intro. This probably means that the story events in '99 happens after the events of KOF '97, and KOF '98 was just a game to satisfy the gamers without a proper storyline to continue. <Orochi K> Since Psyke hasn't updated the FAQ although 2000 was out and now that 2001 is finally out, I e-mailed him with all the info so he would update it but apparently, he doesn't use that mail anymore which shows he is really out of FAQ-writing. Anyway, I'm updating it for him by adding the characters for 2000 and 2001 along with some corrections. Enjoy! Special thanks to Blader-X <juan.calcano@codetel.net.do> for doing the other games (Garou, AOF, Psycho Soldier, Ikari Warriors) and ShadowNash for doing the list of the newer titles (cross-overs, handheld releases). ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Key: 94 : The King Of Fighters '94 95 : The King Of Fighters '95 96 : The King Of Fighters '96 97 : The King Of Fighters '97 98 : The King Of Fighters '98: Dream Match Never Ends 99 : The King Of Fighters '99: Millennium Battle 99E : The King Of Fighters '99: Evolution (Dreamcast version of '99 with additional strikers. I will only be stating the 5 additional strikers) 2K : The King of Fighters 2000 (covers past characters who now appear as alternate or maniac strikers) 2K1 : The King of Fighters 2001 R1 : The King of Fighters R1 (NGP) R2 : The King of Fighters R2 (NGPC) EX : The King of Fighters EX (GBA) FF : Fatal Fury FF2 : Fatal Fury 2 FFS : Fatal Fury Special FF3 : Fatal Fury 3 RBF : Real Bout Fatal Fury RBS : Real Bout Fatal Fury Special RB2 : Real Bout Fatal Fury 2 WA : Fatal Fury: Wild Ambition (PSX only) MOTW : Garou Mark of the Wolves FFC : Fatal Fury First Contact (NGPC) AOF : Art of Fighting AO2 : Art of fighting 2 AO3 : Art of fighting 3 PS : Psycho Soldier IWS : Ikari Warriors Series CVS : Capcom vs. SNK CVS2 : Capcom vs. SNK 2 SVC : SNK vs. Capcom (NGPC) GF : Gals' Fighters (NGPC) NOTE: '98 also refers to KOF99: Dream Match for those who don't know. KOF '99 and KOF Evolution on the Dreamcast are the same. ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2) The Cast! (* denotes secret character or home console only character) Character Team Appearances --------- ---- ----------- 1) Kyo Kusanagi Hero Team 94, 95, 96, 97, 98, EX Kyo Team 2K1 Solo Entry *99, 2K God American Sports Team 94, 98 31) Lucky Glauber American Sports Team 94, 98 32) Brian Battler American Sports Team 94, 98 33) Blue Mary 97 Special Team 97, 98 Gal Fighters 99 Fatal Fury Team 2K, 2K1 Original Game FF3, RBF, RBS, RB2 34) Ryuji Yamazaki 97 Special Team 97, 98 Striker 99E, 2K Original Game FF3, RBF, RBS, RB2, WA, FFC Other Games CVS, CVS2 35) Billy Kane Rival Team 95 97 Special Team 97, 98 Striker 99E, 2K Original Game FF, FF2, FFS, FF3, RBF, RBS, RB2, WA, FFC 36) Eiji Kisaragi Rival Team 95 Striker 2K Original Game AOF2 37) Iori Yagami Iori Team 95 Yagami Team 96, 98, 2K1 Solo Entry 97, *99, 2K, R2, *EX God Savior Team R1 Other Games SVC, CVS, CVS2 38) Mature Yagami Team 96, 98 Striker 2K 39) Vice Yagami Team 96, 98 Striker 2K Other Games CVS, CVS2 40) Saishu Kusanagi Single Entry 95 Masters Team 98 Kusanagi Team R2 Striker 2K 41) Yashiro Nanakase New Face Team 97, R1, R2 Orochi Team *97, 98 Striker 2K 42) Shermie New Face Team 97, R1, R2 Orochi Team *97, 98 Striker 2K Other Games GF 43) Chris New Face Team 97, R1, R2 Orochi Team *97, 98 Striker 2K 44) Geese Howard 96 Boss Team 96 Solo Entry *EX Striker 2K Original Game FF, FFS, FF3, RBF, RBS, RB2, WA, FFC Other Games AOF2, *SVC, CVS, CVS2 45) Wolfgang Krauser 96 Boss Team 96 Original Game FF2, FFS, FF3, RBF, RBS, RB2, FFC 46) Mr. Big 96 Boss Team 96 Original Game AOF, AOF2 47) Shingo Yabuki Single Entry 97, 98 New Japan Team 99 Benimaru Team 2K Kyo Team 2K1 Solo Entry R1 Kusanagi Team R2 48) Xiang Fei Gals Fighters 99, 2K1 Striker 2K Original Game RB2, WA, FFC 49) Lin Benimaru Team 2K Hero Team 2K1 50) Seth Benimaru Team 2K Iori Team 2K1 Striker 99E 51) Vanessa Hero Team 2K Iori Team 2K1 Striker 99E 52) Ramon Hero Team 2K Iori Team 2K1 53) Hinako Gals Fighters 2K, 2K1 54) Kula Mid-boss (Single) *2K N.E.S.T.S. Team 2K1 55) Foxy N.E.S.T.S. Team 2K1 Striker 2K 56) K9999 N.E.S.T.S. Team 2K1 57) Angel N.E.S.T.S. Team 2K1 58) Mei Li Korean Team 2K1 59) Moe Habana Hero Team EX 60) Rugal Bernstein Boss (Single) *94 Single Entry 98 Boss (Single) *R2 Striker 2K Other Games CVS, CVS2 61) Goenitz Boss (Single) *96 Striker 2K 62) Orochi Boss (Single) *97 Boss (Single) *R1 63) Omega Rugal Boss (Single) *95, *98 64) Krizalid Boss (Single) *99 65) Zero Boss (Single) *2K 66) Original Zero Boss (Single) *2K1 67) Ling Boss (Single) *2K1 ----------------------------------------------------------------------------- <Psyke> Alright! That's all the characters and their teams/appearances for you! I'd really like to add in their other appearances outside of the KOF series, but I'd really need help for that to happpen. So, if you have the character list for the other SNK games feel free to send them in! <Orochi K> As you may have seen at the top of the guide, Blader-X has already stepped up and the covered the other series. KOF Kyo is still missing though. It's not available in my country and besides, chances that I'll get it are low since I don't understand Japanese. It'd be greatly appreciated if somebody who has played KOF Kyo could send me the cast. Credits ------- <Psyke> 1) My SNK CDs and magazines 2) Choujin-Overfiend for giving me the name of Iori's team in 95 <Orochi K> 1) KOF 2001 Official Homepage <http://www.neogeo.co.jp> 2) My KOF 2000 Striker List 3) Blader-X for covering most non-KOF games (big thanks, man!) 4) KOF EX Official Homepage 5) ShadowNash for covering the other games (CVS, CVS2, etc...) What To Come (what I need from you guys) ---------------------------------------- 1) KOF Kyo's characters 2) Anything I missed or you think should be here! All information collected from various old game magazines and my SNK music soundtracks. : ) Psyke psyke@singnet.com.sg Visit my video gaming world at http://i.am/psyke Orochi K kartelkertra <at> caramail <dot> com Thank you for reading this. KOF forever!
